title: Uprooted, Ep. 4: The Mariel Boatlift
description: People who left Cuba to come to the United States as part of the Mariel Boatlift in 1980 share their experiences of traveling across the sea and their first memories stepping ashore in Florida.
author: web-team@wpr.org (Wisconsin Public Radio)
category: Culture, History, North American History, Justice, Social Issues, Immigration, Latino, Race

media:title: Uprooted, Ep. 4: The Mariel Boatlift
media:description: People who left Cuba to come to the United States as part of the Mariel Boatlift in 1980 share their experiences of traveling across the sea and their first memories stepping ashore in Florida.
media:credit: A Cuban soldier stands by a refugee ship at the small port of Mariel, Cuba, as the refugees aboard wait to sail for U.S.
